CORE.name: Greenhouse Effect
CORE.definition: The process by which radiation from a planet's atmosphere warms the planet's surface to a temperature above what it would be without its atmosphere.

chain: Some radiation is reflected back into space
Remaining radiation is absorbed by the Earth's surface, warming it
The warmed surface emits infrared radiation
Greenhouse gases absorb some of the infrared radiation and re-emit it in all directions, warming the surface and lower atmosphere
More greenhouse gases trap more heat, further warming the planet
GROUNDING.evidence_summary: Observed increases in atmospheric greenhouse gas concentrations correlate with increases in global average temperatures. Climate models incorporating the greenhouse effect accurately predict historical temperature trends and future warming scenarios. Satellite measurements confirm that less infrared radiation is escaping into space at wavelengths absorbed by greenhouse gases.

lifecycle: Absorption and emission of infrared radiation occur continuously
Concentration of greenhouse gases changes over time (anthropogenic influence)
